III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Unknown youth resides at Children's Village BTS program. A
quarterly survey is given out to the youths at Children's Village. A
youth wrote on their survey that a staff did something to them that
rhymes with grape. The youth is one of the 6 males on level 8.1.
The youth has been in the program for over 6 months. It is
unknown who the staff or the victim is.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2025, and
reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June
17, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A said
he has been placed at Children’s Village “a few times” and
whenever he has been placed there, he has been given a survey
“every few months” and he always fills it out and turns it into staff.
Youth A said the most recent survey was earlier this month and he
remembers completing it during school. Youth A at first denied
writing the statement on the survey however once confronted with
handwriting samples that showed his handwriting from a journal
was the exact same as the survey he admitted he wrote it. Youth
A adamantly denied anything ever happening to him and said he
would “refuse a rape kit” if asked to complete one. Youth A denied
ever seeing any staff acting inappropriately with any youth at
Children’s Village.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 17,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said he
works with the BTS youth and is aware of the surveys that are
given. Staff 1 said the June 2025 surveys were given to him from
Staff 3 on June 4, 2025; to distribute to the youth however due to
other things going on that day he did not pass them out to the
youth. Staff 1 said on June 5, 2025, he called into the unit and
asked a different staff to pass them out to the youth to complete.
Staff 1 said he did not see the surveys after that time. Staff 1 said
the surveys are anonymous and once completed they are given
back to Staff 3. Staff 1 said no youth, including Youth A, have ever
disclosed any concerns about being sexually abused by staff.
2

Staff 1 said no youth, including Youth A, has ever disclosed
feeling unsafe around any staff. Staff 1 said he has not seen any
concerning behaviors with any staff members and youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 17,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said he is
the Program Supervisor for BTS. Staff 2 said he was not a part of
the surveys being completed. Staff 2 said Staff 3 was the staff that
reviewed the survey’s, and he was made aware of the statement
that a youth wrote “a staff doing something to him the rhymes with
grape”. Staff 2 said no youth, including Youth A, has ever
disclosed any concerns about being sexually abused by staff.
Staff 2 denied any youth, including Youth A, ever verbalizing
concerns about their safety around any of the staff at Children’s
Village. Staff 2 said he has not seen or heard any concerning
behaviors between staff and youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Children’s Village Youth Participant Survey’s were
reviewed. The disclosure writing is very distinct, especially
in the way that the lower-case d and i are written.
• Handwriting Samples for the BTS youth were reviewed.
When comparing writing, the writing matches that of Youth
A, with the same distinct d and i letters.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per Youth A and staff
interviews there is no evidence to believe a staff has sexually
abused youth at Children’s Village.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to assure
compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL
722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Finding or rule noncompliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not report suspected child abuse timely.
Investigation A conversation occurred with Director on June 26, 2025, via
telephone. Director was asked to further explain the timeline of
the surveys being given out, when reviewed, and when she was
made aware of the statement. Director said the surveys are
quarterly PREA surveys and were completed in June. Director
said she was made aware of the youth statement via email from
3

Staff 3 around 10am on June 13, 2025. Director said she followed
up with Staff 3 who reported she had reviewed the surveys the
evening prior, June 12, 2025. Director said Staff 3 reported the
suspected child abuse shortly after she sent the June 13, 2025,
10am email.
Email dated June 13, 2025, at 9:50am from Staff 3 to Director
was reviewed and stated the following:
The BTS residents have completed the June, 2025 surveys. One
of the BTS residents entered a serious allegation of sexual abuse
in his survey comments section. The resident stated the following:
“Staff did something to me that rhymes with Grape.”
The identifying data on his survey is below:
• 16 years of age
• On Level 8.1
• Been in program for 6+ months.
There are currently 5 male youth residing in BTS. Please advise if
you wish me to take any further action. At this time, I do not know
the identity of the complainant.
Email dated June 13, 2025, at 4:49pm from Director to Staff 3
was reviewed and stated the following:
I’d like to get some clarification for the [MDHHS] worker. The
surveys are all dated 6/5/25. Can you please confirm they were
distributed on that date and tell me where and what time they
were distributed? We may want to review camera footage. Also,
did you distribute them yourself or leave them and have someone
else pass them out? Lastly, when were they collected and when
did you notice the comment?
Thanks!
Email dated June 13, 2025, at 5:17pm from Staff 3 to Director
was reviewed and stated the following:
The blank surveys were given to staff the first week in June. Staff
can tell us when the residents were given the surveys. Staff work
around the residents’ schedule. I read the comments section of
the BTS surveys late yesterday, around 5 PM; as I planned to
start pulling together data for survey reporting today. I reported the
allegations this morning.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS Intake for this investigation was reviewed. The
allegations were reported on June 13, 2025, at 12:09pm.
• Children’s Village Compliance with the Child Protection
Law Policy was reviewed.
4

o The policy states, “A Children’s Village employee
who has reasonable cause to suspect child abuse or
neglect shall make immediately, by telephone or
otherwise, an oral report, or cause an oral report to
be made, of the suspected child abuse or neglect to
the department (DHHS).”
o The procedure is outlined for staff as follows:
1. Any staff member, upon observing or hearing of
any allegation of abuse or neglect shall
immediately report to his/her immediate
supervisor.
2. After notifying their supervisor the reporting staff
member will immediately contact CPS. Reporting
includes a telephone call to the 24-hour number
1-855-444-3911 or the online filing of the
allegation. If the allegation is called in by phone
the employee must follow-up by completing a
paper version of the 3200 and faxing it to the
number on the form. The log number (provided
during the call) should be documented on the
form. Copies of all 3200 forms will be given to
the Administrator, Treatment Services
Supervisor, Medical Unit, and the Case
Coordinator for placement into the resident’s file.
The original 3200 will be forwarded to the
Manager.
3. During business hours the supervisor receiving a
report of, or observing, possible abuse or neglect
shall immediately notify the administrator to
whom he/she reports. After business hours, the
on-call administrator is to be immediately
contacted regardless of day of week or time of
day.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per documents
reviewed Staff 3 reviewed the youth survey’s at 5pm on Thursday,
June 12, 2025, and did not report the suspected child abuse until
Friday, June 13, 2025, at 12:09pm. In addition, Staff 3 did not
notify her supervisor or the on-call administration immediately per
the facility policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
